intro: Isoetes chaboissaei, commonly known as the Chaboissai watermoss, is a species of aquatic plant belonging to the genus Isoetes, which is part of the order Isoetales. It is characterized by its unique, spore-bearing structures called sporangia, which are typically found on specialized leaves called sporophylls. This plant is typically found in freshwater habitats, such as lakes and ponds, where it can thrive in shallow, still waters. Its morphology includes a rosette-like arrangement of leaves, with the sporophylls extending upward from the central axis. Isoetes chaboissaei plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to the structure and biodiversity of its habitat.
